{{convert|1613|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (ID.5) | weight = {{convert|1891|-|2224|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}} | predecessor = | successor = | powerout = {{Convert|146-302|hp|PS kW|abbr=on|adj=on}}{{Cite news|url=https://electrek.co/2017/11/29/vw-debuts-all-electric-suv-concept-in-the-us-first-next-gen-ev/|title=VW debuts all-electric SUV concept in the US, says it will be its first next-gen EV in the market|date=2017-11-29|work=[[Electrek]]|access-date=2017-11-30|language=en-US|archive-date=2021-02-14|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210214130724/https://electrek.co/2017/11/29/vw-debuts-all-electric-suv-concept-in-the-us-first-next-gen-ev/|url-status=live}} }} The '''Volkswagen ID.4''' and '''Volkswagen ID.5''' are [[Battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] [[compact crossover SUV]]s produced by [[Volkswagen]]. Based on the [[Volkswagen Group MEB platform|MEB platform]], the ID.4 is the second model of the [[Volkswagen ID. series]]. The production version of the ID.4 debuted in September 2020 as the first fully-electric crossover SUV under the Volkswagen brand,{{cite web|date=28 Aug 2020|title=NEWSROOM: RSVP for an EV SUV with a $100 reservation for the Volkswagen ID.4 electric vehicle|url=https://media.vw.com/releases/1380|access-date=1 September 2020|publisher=Volkswagen US Media Site|archive-date=29 August 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200829084258/https://media.vw.com/releases/1380|url-status=live}} while the [[Coupe SUV|coupe-shaped]] variant of the ID.4 (akin to the [[Audi e-tron (2018)#Sportback version|Audi Q8 Sportback e-tron]]) is marketed as the Volkswagen ID.5 and was revealed in November 2021. The ID.4 is positioned by Volkswagen as a high-volume, [[mass-market]] [[electric vehicle]] — a car for "the millions, not the millionaires," as the company claimed in its advertising.{{Cite |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/a45085339/2024-volkswagen-id5-drive/ |access-date=2023-10-12 |website=Car and Driver |language=en-US}} == Overview == The ID.4 was previewed the [[Volkswagen I.D. Crozz|I.D. Crozz]] and I.D. Crozz II concept cars, which debuted in 2017 at the [[Shanghai Auto Show|Shanghai]] and [[Frankfurt Auto Show#2017|Frankfurt Auto Show]], respectively.{{cite news|title=Volkswagen ID Crozz inches closer to production, still has bad name|url=https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/auto/2020-volkswagen-i-d-crozz/preview/|access-date=11 September 2017|work=CNET.com|date=11 September 2017|archive-date=11 September 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170911193401/https://www.cnet.com/roadshow/auto/2020-volkswagen-i-d-crozz/preview/|url-status=live}} A prototype version of the ID.4 appeared in camouflage at the [[Frankfurt Motor Show#2019|2019 Frankfurt Motor Show]] discreetly so as not to steal the show from the first electric mass-market vehicle of the German brand, the [[Volkswagen I.D.3|ID.3]].{{cite web|title=Volkswagen ID.4 : planqué dans un bocal|url=https://www.moniteurautomobile.be/actu-auto/salon-auto-francfort-2019/volkswagen-id4-bocal.html|first=Olivier|last=Duquesne|agency=Le Moniteur automobile|date=10 September 2019|access-date=4 March 2020|archive-date=8 August 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200808091704/https://www.moniteurautomobile.be/actu-auto/salon-auto-francfort-2019/volkswagen-id4-bocal.html|url-status=live}} The production version was unveiled globally on 23 September 2020. Unlike the [[Volkswagen ID.3|ID.3]] which is oriented mainly for the European market, the ID.4 also targeted the North American region as one of its core markets. [[Volkswagen Group of America]] CEO Scott Keogh went as far as saying the ID.4 "drives like a [[Volkswagen GTI|GTI]], it has the packaging of a [[Volkswagen Tiguan|Tiguan]] and the purpose of the [[Volkswagen Beetle|Beetle]]," to emphasize its driving dynamics, design, and technology.{{Cite web|last=Mihalascu|first=Dan|title=2021 VW ID.4 EV Offers 250 Mile-Range, 201HP RWD Powertrain For $39,995|url=https://www.carscoops.com/2020/09/2021-vw-id-4-ev-offers-250-mile-range-201hp-rwd-powertrain-for-39995/|access-date=2020-09-23|website=Carscoops|archive-date=2020-09-24|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200924212157/https://www.carscoops.com/2020/09/2021-vw-id-4-ev-offers-250-mile-range-201hp-rwd-powertrain-for-39995/|url-status=live}} At launch, the electric SUV was solely offered with [[rear-wheel-drive]] and an [[electric motor]] located at the rear axle, with the dual motor [[all-wheel-drive]] version following later. First sales were for the ID.4 "1st edition", which differs in some interior and exterior features from the series production models.{{Cite web|title=Volkswagen ID.4 to launch for €49,950|url=https://www.electrive.com/2020/09/23/volkswagen-id-4-to-launch-for-e49950/|url-status=live|access-date=2021-04-20|website=www.electrive.com|archive-date=2021-04-20|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210420160022/https://www.electrive.com/2020/09/23/volkswagen-id-4-to-launch-for-e49950/}} Headlights and taillights are mostly [[LED lamp|LED]] lamps on the ID.4, with [[Matrix LED]] lights being an optional feature in some regions. The front features a low-positioned air inlet behind which the [[Radiator (engine cooling)|radiator]] and parts of the [[Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning|air conditioning system]] are located. Short overhangs and a wheelbase of {{cvt|2766|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} add up to a length of {{cvt|4584|mm|in|1|abbr=on}}. Wheels are offered in 18–21 inch sizes. RWD models can tow a maximum of {{convert|1,000|kg|lb|abbr=on}} braked with an optional tow bar and fits roof rails as standard.{{Cite web|title=Press Information on the ID.4 March 2021|url=https://www.vwpress.co.uk/assets/documents/original/29187-ID4presspackMarch2021.pdf|url-status=live|access-date=20 April 2021|archive-date=20 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210420160022/https://www.vwpress.co.uk/assets/documents/original/29187-ID4presspackMarch2021.pdf}} [[CarPlay|Apple Carplay]] and [[Android Auto]] are offered as standard, in addition to an optional [[Augmented reality head-up display|augmented reality]] [[Head-up display|head-up display (HUD)]]. In addition to the 5.3 inch driver display, the ID.4 features a 10-inch infotainment screen, though an optional 12 inch screen is available. By default, the vehicle includes a light strip below the windscreen providing visual cues related to certain functions such as the state of charge (SOC) when charging or brake alerts, which VW calls "ID. Light". Safety features include VW's [[Car2X]] communication system. An optional [[heat pump]] extending range under low temperature conditions is offered or even fitted as standard in certain markets such as Canada{{Cite web|title=Electric Vehicle Range {{!}} Volkswagen Canada|url=https://www.vw.ca/en/electric-vehicles/about-electric-vehicles/ev-range.html|access-date=2021-04-20|website=www.vw.ca|language=en|archive-date=2021-04-20|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210420160022/https://www.vw.ca/en/electric-vehicles/about-electric-vehicles/ev-range.html|url-status=live}} and uses a [[R744]] (CO2) refrigerant.{{Cite web|title=Volkswagen Offering CO2 Heat Pump for Electric Vehicles|url=http://r744.com/|access-date=2021-04-20|website=r744.com|archive-date=2021-04-19|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210419003225/http://r744.com/|url-status=live}} It is claimed to heat the cabin 2-3 times more efficiently than a [[Electric heating|resistance heater]]. The boot offers 848 L of volume and 1,817 L when the rear seats are folded. The vehicle does not offer a storage compartment at the front end ("frunk"). The ID. 4 will be launched in [[Australasia]] along with the [[Volkswagen ID.3|ID.3]], [[#Volkswagen ID.5|ID.5]] and [[Volkswagen ID. Buzz|ID. Buzz]] in Mid-2024 {{cite news|url=https://www.drive.com.au/news/volkswagen-id-electric-car-rollout-australia/|title=2024 Volkswagen ID.4, ID.5 and ID.3 electric car roll-out detailed for Australia|author=Misoyannis, Alex|date=9 August 2022|work=Drive Australia|access-date=9 August 2022}} For the 2024 model year, the ID.4/5 receives an update including a larger 12.9 inch infotainment display with new software, 82 kWh models also get an upgraded [[APP 550]] motor, providing improved power and efficiency at the same time.{{Cite web |title=Upgrade for the ID.4 and ID.5: new infotainment system with intuitive operation, new electric drive with more power and efficiency |url=https://www.volkswagen-newsroom.com/en/press-releases/upgrade-for-the-id4-and-id5-new-infotainment-system-with-intuitive-operation-new-electric-drive-with-more-power-and-efficiency-17728 |access-date=2023-11-23 |website=Volkswagen Newsroom |language=en}} File:2021 Volkswagen ID.4 City Rear.jpg|Rear view File:VW ID4 Family Innen.jpg|Interior === Volkswagen ID.5 === The Volkswagen ID.5 was previewed in August 2021, revealed in November 2021, and produced since January 2022.{{Cite web|title=VW ID.5 RWD And ID.5 GTX AWD Electric Crossover Coupes Are Here|url=https://insideevs.com/news/545110/vw-id5-id5-gtx-debut/|access-date=2021-11-04|website=InsideEVs|language=en}}{{Cite web|last=Panait|first=Mircea|date=2022-01-27|title=Volkswagen ID.5 Enters Series Production, Base Variant Costs 46,515 Euros|url=https://www.autoevolution.com/news/volkswagen-id5-enters-series-production-base-variant-costs-46515-euros-180222.html|access-date=2022-01-27|website=autoevolution|language=en}} It features a lower 0.26 drag coefficient, which is 0.02 lower than the ID.4. The model is available in three variants, which are Pro, Pro Performance and GTX, with the latter using a dual motor all-wheel-drive layout. Three powertrain options are available, although unlike the ID.4, the ID.5 comes with just one battery capacity, which is 77 kWh. The ID.5's sloping roofline decreases the cargo space, which offers 549 L with the rear seats up and 1,561 L with the seats folded.{{Cite web|title=VW ID.5 Debuts With Coupe-Like Roof, GTX Trim, Familiar Design|url=https://www.motor1.com/news/545067/volkswagen-id5-gtx-ev-debuts/|access-date=2021-11-04|website=Motor1.com|language=en}} File:Volkswagen ID.5 GTX 1X7A0318.jpg|Volkswagen ID.5 GTX File:Volkswagen ID.5 GTX 1X7A0138.jpg|Rear view {{clear}} == Specifications == {{Update section|date=March 2024|reason=Specs table still needs to be updated: a new column should be added for the European ID.4 Pro 4MOTION, which is AWD like the GTX, but has different power output than the GTX.}} === Powertrain === Since model year 2024, the ID.4 is fitted with the [[APP 550]] electric drive, which is an oil-cooled [[Brushless DC electric motor|brushless]] [[Synchronous motor#Permanent-magnet|permanently excited synchronous machine]] positioned at the rear axle. The motor produces up to {{cvt|210|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}} of power and up to {{convert|550|Nm|lbft|abbr=on}} of torque,{{cite web | url=https://www.volkswagen-newsroom.com/en/press-releases/new-drive-for-the-all-electric-id-family-more-performance-and-higher-efficiency-15699 | title=New drive for the all-electric ID. Family: More performance and higher efficiency }} revolving at speeds of up to 16,000 [[Revolutions per minute|rpm]]. All-wheel drive variants have an additional motor on the front axle. The ID.4 [[Regenerative brake|recuperates]] energy when braking using the service brake pedal, with up to 0.25 [[G-force|g]]. When driving with the gear selector set to “D” mode, if the driver lifts their foot off the [[accelerator pedal]], the vehicle is set to [[Coasting (vehicle)|coast]] along in order to preserve energy, with the motor freely rotating. However the vehicle can also be set to “B” mode where it will recuperate instead, again with forces of up to 0.25 g. When stronger deceleration is required, the vehicle uses electrically boosted conventional [[hydraulic brake]]s. === Battery === The battery consists of a [[Lithium-ion battery|lithium-Ion]] [[battery pack]] which houses 9 battery modules in 10 compartments (Pure) or 12 modules (Pro) containing the individual [[Electrochemical cell|battery cells]] (24 per module) in a rectangular aluminium casing which sits in the vehicle's underbody. While the smaller battery holds an energy content of 55 kWh, of which 52 kWh are made available to the user, the larger pack comes in at 82/77 kWh. A model with a 62 kWh gross, 58 kWh net battery pack was released for the North American market in 2022. The battery's thermal management system is designed to maintain the battery's temperature around the ideal range of {{convert|25|C|F|abbr=on}} and utilises liquid cooling. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ !Battery Capacity

It is powered by a 62 kWh or 82 kWh battery pack (gross capacity) positioned in the underbody. The 82 kWh battery pack offers a range of {{Convert|245-280|mi|km|0|abbr=on}} on a full charge on the [[United States Environmental Protection Agency|EPA]] cycle, depending on version.{{Cite web |title=2022 Volkswagen ID.4 range boosted, now up to 280 miles |url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1135130_2022-volkswagen-id-4-range-boosted-now-up-to-280-miles |access-date=2022-08-29 |website=Green Car Reports |date=23 February 2022 |language=en}} The 62 kWh battery pack is rated at {{convert|209|mi|km}} by the EPA.{{Cite web |title=2023 Volkswagen ID.4 |url=https://www.fueleconomy.gov/feg/Find.do?action=sbs&id=46032 |access-date=2023-06-11 |website=www.fueleconomy.gov}} 2021-2022 models were imported to North America and built in the [[Volkswagen Zwickau-Mosel Plant]] or Emden plant since model year 2022. In August 2022, Volkswagen announced production location changes and added features for 2023 model year ID.4s, the Volkswagen ID.4 sold in North America will be made in [[Volkswagen Chattanooga Assembly Plant|Volkswagen's Chattanooga Tennessee Assembly Plant]]. Chattanooga began producing the ID.4 on July 26, 2022.{{Cite web|last=Ravi|first=Anjan|title=2023 VW ID.4 produced in Chattanooga launched in the U.S. [Update]|url=https://topelectricsuv.com/news/volkswagen/vw-id4-best-selling-electric-suv/#ID4_production_brings_new_jobs_to_Chattanooga|access-date=2023-07-25|website=topelectricsuv.com|date=14 February 2023 |language=en}} The North American ID.4 got a moderate refresh for model year 2023. It introduced a new 62 kWh battery pack that is now on the new Standard and S trim levels. The 62 kWh (gross) battery pack is provided exclusively by SK On and has a peak charging rate of 140 kW. The Standard trim level reduced the base price of the ID.4 to $37,495 (up to $38,995 since December 2022). The larger 82 kWh (gross) battery pack got updated and since December 2022, it is split between two battery suppliers to increase production output, SK On and LG Energy Solution. On 82 kWh ''RWD'' models, some vehicles get the SK On battery pack providing a 170 kW peak charging speed, while other vehicles get the LG Energy Solutions battery pack with a 135 kW peak charging speed as used in most pre-2023 model year vehicles. All 82 kWh ''AWD'' models get the SK On battery with the 170 kW peak charging. Volkswagen quotes a 10-80% DC fast charging time of 30 minutes for the SK On battery pack and 36 minutes for the LG battery pack. The battery capacity and EPA rated range are identical between the two battery packs.{{Cite web |last=Patel |first=Joel |date=30 December 2022 |title=Volkswagen ID.4 SK vs. LG Batteries Explained |url=https://www.carsdirect.com/automotive-news/green-technology/volkswagen-id-4-sk-vs-lg-batteries-explained}} The 2023 refresh also includes a redesigned center console, a larger 12-inch Discover Pro Max infotainment system, Park Assist Plus (autonomous parking system), assisted lane changing to the semi-autonomous highway assist system branded Volkswagen Travel Assist (Travel Assist is standard on every North American ID.4, however, 2021-22 models do not have the assisted lane change function) and 45-watt USB-C fast device charging standard across all trims. As well as new options like [[Omniview technology|Area View (surround view camera system)]], three-zone automatic climate control, heated rear seats, and new paint colors.{{Cite web |title=Volkswagen announces pricing for the 2023 ID.4 electric SUV |url=https://media.vw.com/en-us/releases/1699}} === China === The Volkswagen ID.4 is available as two variants in China called the ID.4 X and the ID.4 Crozz. The two variants feature slightly different styling and are produced by [[SAIC-Volkswagen]] and [[FAW-Volkswagen]] respectively.{{Cite web|last=Bruce|first=Chris|title=VW ID.4 Gets X Version With Smoother Styling For Chinese Market|url=https://www.motor1.com/news/452488/vw-id4-x-china-model/|access-date=2021-03-27|website=Motor1|archive-date=2021-01-25|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210125143529/https://www.motor1.com/news/452488/vw-id4-x-china-model/|url-status=live}} The ID.4 Crozz is similar to the European ID.4 and is offered with a smaller battery and a range of {{Convert|400|km|mi|0|abbr=on}} and {{convert|125|kW|hp PS|0|abbr=on}} of power as well as a longer-ranged version offering {{Convert|550|km|mi|0|abbr=on}} of range according to the [[New European Driving Cycle|NEDC]] test and {{convert|150|kW|hp PS|0|abbr=on}} of power.
